chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
m: nat
v: Vector.t nat m
u: pos m
i: nat

Goal:
exp i (v[(1 + (v#>u))/u]) = qs (u + i) * exp i v

Premises:
Inductive t : nat -> Set := F1 : forall n : nat, pos (S n) | FS : forall n : nat, pos n -> pos (S n) Arguments Fin.t _%nat_scope Arguments Fin.F1 {n}%nat_scope Arguments Fin.FS {n}%nat_scope
exp = fix exp (n i : nat) (v : vec nat n) {struct v} : nat := match v with | vec_nil => 1 | Vector.cons _ x n0 v0 => qs i ^ x * exp n0 (S i) v0 end : forall n : nat, nat -> vec nat n -> nat Arguments exp {n}%nat_scope _%nat_scope
Module Vector := Struct Inductive t (A : Type) : nat -> Type := nil : t A 0 | cons : A -> forall n : nat, t A n -> t A (S n) Definition t_rect : forall (A : Type) (P : forall n : nat, vec A n -> Type), P 0 vec_nil -> (forall (h : A) (n : nat) (t : vec A n), P n t -> P (S n) (h ## t)) -> forall (n : nat) (t : vec A n), P n t. Definition t_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : forall n : nat, vec A n -> Prop), P 0 vec_nil -> (forall (h : A) (n : nat) (t : vec A n), P n t -> P (S n) (h ## t)) -> forall
Notation pos := Fin.t
qs = {| str := fun n : nat => nthprime (1 + 2 * n); str_inj := fun (n m : nat) (H : nthprime (1 + 2 * n) = nthprime (1 + 2 * m)) => let H0 : 1 + 2 * n = 1 + 2 * m := nthprime_inj (1 + 2 * n) (1 + 2 * m) H in (fun lemma : n = m <-> BinInt.Z.of_nat n = BinInt.Z.of_nat m => Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation (n = m) (BinInt.Z.of_nat n = BinInt.Z.of_nat m) lemma) (ZifyClasses.mkrel nat BinNums.Z eq BinInt.Z.of_nat eq (fun x y : nat => iff_sym (Znat.Nat2Z.inj_iff x y
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
exp_app : forall (n m i : nat) (v : vec nat n) (w : vec nat m), exp i (vec_app v w) = exp i v * exp (n + i) w
exp_cons : forall (n i x : nat) (v : vec nat n), exp i (x ## v) = qs i ^ x * exp (S i) v
vec_prod_div : forall (m : nat) (v : vec nat m) (u0 : nat) (p : pos m) (i : nat), v#>p = S u0 -> qs (p + i) * exp i (v[u0/p]) = exp i v
exp_nil : forall i : nat, exp i vec_nil = 1
exp_zero : forall n i : nat, exp i vec_zero = 1
Fin.weak : forall p : nat, (pos ?m -> pos ?n) -> pos (p + ?m) -> pos (p + ?n) where ?m : [m : nat v : vec nat m u : pos m i : nat |- nat] ?n : [m : nat v : vec nat m u : pos m i : nat |- nat]
pos_S_inv : forall p : pos (S ?n), (p = pos0) + {q : pos ?n | p = pos_nxt q} where ?n : [m : nat v : vec nat m u : pos m i : nat |- nat]
VectorDef.splitat : forall l r : nat, vec ?A (l + r) -> vec ?A l * vec ?A r where ?A : [m : nat v : vec nat m u : pos m i : nat |- Type]
vec_pos_fun2vec : forall (X : Type) (i n : nat) (f : nat -> X) (p : pos n), fun2vec i n f#>p = f (i + pos2nat p)
fun2vec_id : forall (X : Type) (i n : nat) (f : nat -> X), fun2vec i n f = vec_set_pos (fun p : pos n => f (i + pos2nat p))
qs_exp_div : forall (i j n : nat) (v : vec nat n), i < j -> ~ divides (qs i) (exp j v)
pow2_2n1_dec : forall n : nat, {p : nat & {b : nat | S n = pow2 p * (2 * b + 1)}}
bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q /\ a <= q /\ b <= p}}
Nat.mul_add_distr_l : forall n m p : nat, n * (m + p) = n * m + n * p
pos_O_inv = let pos_inv_t := fun n : nat => match n as x return (pos x -> Set) with | 0 => fun _ : pos 0 => False | S n0 => fun i : pos (S n0) => ((i = pos0) + {p : pos n0 | i = pos_nxt p})%type end in let pos_inv := fun (_tmp : nat) (p0 : pos _tmp) => match p0 as t in (pos n) return (pos_inv_t n t) with | @Fin.F1 n => inl eq_refl | @Fin.FS n p => inr (exist (fun p1 : pos n => pos_nxt p = pos_nxt p1) p eq_refl) end in pos_inv 0 : pos 0 -> False
vec_change_pred : forall (n : nat) (v : vec nat n) (p : pos n) (u : nat), v#>p = S u -> v = vec_plus (vec_one p) (v[u/p])
euclid : forall n d : nat, d <> 0 -> {q : nat & {r : nat | n = q * d + r /\ r < d}}
vec_pos_plus : forall (n : nat) (v w : vec nat n) (p : pos n), vec_plus v w#>p = (v#>p) + (w#>p)
vec_plus_is_zero : forall (n : nat) (u v : vec nat n), vec_zero = vec_plus u v -> u = vec_zero /\ v = vec_zero
euclid_2 : forall n : nat, exists q : nat, n = 2 * q \/ n = 1 + 2 * q
ps_exp : forall (n m : nat) (v : vec nat m) (i : nat), ~ divides (ps n) (exp i v)
vec_plus = fun (n : nat) (v w : vec nat n) => vec_set_pos (fun p : pos n => (v#>p) + (w#>p)) : forall n : nat, vec nat n -> vec nat n -> vec nat n Arguments vec_plus {n}%nat_scope
pos_both : forall n m : nat, pos (n + m) -> pos n + pos m
Nat.add_assoc : forall n m p : nat, n + (m + p) = n + m + p
vec_plus_assoc : forall (n : nat) (u v w : vec nat n), vec_plus u (vec_plus v w) = vec_plus (vec_plus u v) w
ring_subst_niter = 10 * 10 * 10 : nat
div_rem_spec1 : forall q p : nat, q = div q p * p + rem q p
div2_spec : forall n : nat, let (p, b) := div2 n in if b then n = 2 * p + 1 else n = 2 * p
vec_pos_app_right : forall (X : Type) (n m : nat) (v : vec X n) (w : vec X m) (i : pos m), vec_app v w#>pos_right n i = w#>i
vec_pos_app_left : forall (X : Type) (n m : nat) (v : vec X n) (w : vec X m) (i : pos n), vec_app v w#>pos_left m i = v#>i
